intro: Hemimeris alsinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Hemimeris alsinoides is an important component of desert ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in fragile environments.
